title: webjars-locator does not work with quarkus.http.root-path set
body:
### Describe the bug

The `quarkus-webjars-locator` extension only works properly if `quarkus.http.root-path` is equal to `/`.

### Expected behavior

Webjar content should be accessible as described in the [HTTP reference][1], regardless of the value of `quarkus.http.root-path`.

With a webjar dependency like this one:

```xml
    <dependency>
      <groupId>io.quarkus</groupId>
      <artifactId>quarkus-webjars-locator</artifactId>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.webjars</groupId>
      <artifactId>jquery-ui</artifactId>
      <version>1.13.0</version>
    </dependency>
```

And an `application.properties` of:

```properties
quarkus.http.root-path=/app
```

Both of these paths should return `HTTP 200 OK`:
1. `GET /app/webjars/jquery-ui/1.13.0/jquery-ui.min.js`
2. `GET /app/webjars/jquery-ui/jquery-ui.min.js`

[1]: https://quarkus.io/guides/http-reference#webjar-locator-support

### Actual behavior

Trying to access the path without a version (`GET /app/webjars/jquery-ui/jquery-ui.min.js`)  results in a `HTTP 404 Not found`.

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: https://github.com/eliasnorrby/quarkus-webjars-locator-bug-reproduction

Follow the steps in the README to reproduce.
